result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith A Koss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called: 11:03 am 
INCLUDES 15CM1216, 16CF796, 17CF701.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Dan Cveykus and Atty Jack Bliss;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
16CF796:
Ct. 1 (Stangulation and Suffocation-Domestic Abuse)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer)>>DRI.
Amend Ct. 3 to Ct. 3 (Resisting an Officer) pursuant to 946.41.

17CF701:
Ct. 1 (Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
15CM1216:
Ct. 1 (Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd))>> NO CONTEST.

16CF796:
Ct. 3 (Resisting an Officer)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 4 (BJ)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 5 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
15CM1216:
Ct. 1 (Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd))>> $1,694 fine inclusive, DNA Sample. 45 Days MCJ. Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 24 months, as is the defendant himself, and device to be installed immediately; 1/2 priced IID installation fee to be paid; 24 Months dl revocation with any administrative credit; AODA. Court finds 45 Days credit. 

16CF796:
Ct. 3 (Resisting an Officer)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Enroll in and Complete the SAFE Program, AODA and Follow up, Counseling as recommended, Good Faith Effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 12 Hours of Community Service, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample.

Ct. 4 (BJ)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Enroll in and Complete the SAFE Program, AODA and Follow up, Counseling as recommended, Good Faith Effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 12 Hours of Community Service, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample.

Ct. 5 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Enroll in and Complete the SAFE Program, AODA and Follow up, Counseling as recommended, Good Faith Effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 12 Hours of Community Service, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge and Domestic Abuse Surcharge, DNA Sample.

COURT SIGNS 1/2 PRICED IID AND EXEMPTION FORM.

Adjourned: 11:16 am
Plea hearing on October 13, 2017 at 10:45 am.
Status conference on September 20, 2017 at 10:15 am.

Includes 15CM1216, 16CF796 and 17CF701. $2,500.00 SIGNATURE W/ FIRST $250.00 CASH    Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202. Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.  No contact with victim(s):  M.E. & A.R. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.
